issue.title: m.facebook.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://m.facebook.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.facebook.com) ### Comment Username: @MinisterOfOffense > AdGuard blocks the image from Promoted Posts, but not the text. Plus the website is jittery while scrolling up or down. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
As of tonight, “Sponsored” posts are back in full force. Updated AdGuard filters, disabled then re-enabled all filters, Advanced Protection is enabled. 

See attached. 

![A192B33E-717B-453D-B609-A46DDE402613](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/116531838/201236904-a2d518ad-31a0-41ad-af00-97ae43800f81.jpeg)

issue.title: www.newsbreak.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.newsbreak.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbreak.com%2F) ### Comment > Not sure if it’s blocking correctly through a browser. But this is through the official app on the AppStore. The standard Adguard filter used to catch these ad’s. So this could be on their end and not particularly an Adguard issue. But it’s worth taking a look. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.youtube.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2F) ### Comment Username: @MojoZone9 > I can go to YouTube's home page and it works just fine. When I enter anything into the search bar, most of the page gets blocked. I had gone into AdGuard when the issue was first noticed and deleted a YouTube user rule. Afterward, YouTube worked perfectly. Later that day, the problem arose again. I have deleted all user rules for YouTube and the problem still persists. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/BqJPDX9.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/Gk7eP3s.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Safari v1.11.7 Browser: | Safari Filters: | Ad Blocking:

comment.body:
The problem inexplicably resolved itself without my changing anything.

wrote:

> I can go to YouTube's home page and it works just fine. When I enter
> anything into the search bar, most of the page gets blocked. I had gone

> rule. Afterward, YouTube worked perfectly. Later that day, the problem
